title: Dathea, Ascended
description: Toto, I've a feeling we're not in Kansas anymore.

body.raw:
## Mechanics Refer to [MythicTrap â€” Dathea](https://www.method.gg/guides/vault-of-the-incarnates/dathea-ascended-heroic) for detailed visuals and animations of the mechanics. They have been listed here in brief for reference. A tank swap mechanic which deals 240,325 physical damage and knocks the tank back. Subsequent applications apply a stacking 50% vulnerability to the damage and strength of the knockback. If Dathea's current target isn't within reach she will cast [Aerial Buffet](https://www.wowhead.com/spell=376851), dealing 96,130 nature damage to her current target. Tanks that can get back to her quickly, or prevent knockbacks, can prevent this damage. Dathea creates swirls on the ground that inflicts 48,089 damage upon impact. These swirls will spawn a [Raging Tempest](https://www.wowhead.com/spell=375424) at their location. A tornado moves around the platform dealing 96,130 nature damage and throwing players into the air when hit. They have a couple of effects aside from causing contact dermatitis: 1. They periodically pulse raid damage through [Raging Winds](https://www.wowhead.com/spell=384637). 2. When Dathea casts [Crosswinds](https://www.wowhead.com/spell=388410) the tornadoes will show an arrow and a swirly indicating a direction and location where they intend to move. Shortly thereafter the tornado rapidly moves to this new location, dealing 72,097 nature damage to any players at the destination and throwing them up in the air. Dathea targets a player and applies a DoT that deals 48,082 nature damage instantly and 7,210 nature damage every second for 15 seconds. The debuff also causes the player to take 10% increased nature damage. The debuff is refreshed and duplicated when it comes into contact with another player. This is Dathea's mechanic from _The Primal Council_, only without the pillar to clear it. Since this debuff overlaps with nearly every other mechanic it's incredibly dangerous to the player, and the rest of the raid if they spread it to others. Dathea creates a vortex that pulls players towards her dealing 28,839 nature damage every second for 10 seconds. Players who are pulled into the vortex practice the rapture. This is reasonably countered by raid-movement abilities like [Stampeding Roar](https://www.wowhead.com/spell=77764/stampeding-roar). ### Volatile Infuser Slashes their current target with 156,211 nature damage. The add needs to be tanked. When the Volatile Infuser dies it explodes dealing 60,090 nature damage to all players and doing a considerable knockback. This knockback is used to move across platforms. The Infuser gives love to mommy, increasing her damage by 20% for 20 seconds which stacks. The infuser on the main platform will be killed so that [Blowback](https://www.wowhead.com/spell=387627) can take players to the side platform to interrupt the other infuser. The Infuser will periodically expel swirls which deal 96,130 nature damage to players caught in the impact. ### Thunder Caller Thunder Callers are born with an insatiable lust to cast [Storm Bolt](https://www.wowhead.com/spell=384273) which deals 19,226 nature damage. The spell is interruptable and most forms of CC work on the Thunder Callers. They'll be grouped up and killed regardless. When Thunder Callers spawn they leave a thunderstorm on their respective side platform which makes players take 7,210 nature damage every 2 seconds for 1.5 minutes and increases the damage taken from this ability by 50% per tick. ## Mythic Changes The only change on mythic is the infusers start the fight dormant in a ring around the platform and can be fed the now otherwise permanent [Conductive Marks](https://www.wowhead.com/spell=391686/conductive-mark), granting them 10% energy and awakening them at 100%. - Transferring a debuff to an infuser causes rolling damage, [Static Discharge](https://www.wowhead.com/spell=391717/static-discharge), similar to bursting in Mythic+. This should not go above 2 stacks outside of bloodlust. - Activating an Infuser causes it to wipe the energy from the other dormant infusers. - [Conductive Mark](https://www.wowhead.com/spell=391686/conductive-mark) can still be spread, on top of now being permanent unless given to an infuser. ## Strategy This fight is mechanically demanding in that, at any point, you could be given [Conductive Mark](https://www.wowhead.com/spell=391686/conductive-mark) and will need to know where and when to deposit it. The ranged will also need to be near the next infuser we're activating yet aware of [Crosswinds](https://www.wowhead.com/spell=388410/crosswinds) timers to avoid baiting tornados on top of the infuser itself, which makes the marked players lives harder. The recommended strategy is to force the first infuser to activate on the 2nd set of marks, but since only 4 marks go out in each set one person will be designated to create 2 duplicate marks for 6 total on the first round on pull. The fight then breaks into a rhythm of dumping 2 sets of debuffs into the infuser we're working on activating and then throwing away the first 2 debuffs every 3rd set.
Mark Set Instructions Result
1 {" "} Intentionally create 2 duplicate marks, and place all 6 into at 60% energy
2 Marks to Activates
3 Marks to at 40% energy
4 Marks to at 80% energy
5 First 2 marks to , then last 2 marks to Activates
6 Marks to at 40% energy
7 Marks to at 80% energy
8 First 2 marks to , then last 2 marks to Activates
9 Marks to at 40% energy
10 Marks to at 80% energy
11 First 2 marks to , then last 2 marks to Activates
12 Marks to at 40% energy
13 Marks to at 80% energy
14 ONLY 1 mark to . at 90% energy
It's not strictly important which infuser(s) on sets 5, 8, and 11 are given the first two marks so long as it's not the infuser we're working to activate. However, this recommendation is based around the movement of ranged players, covered later. Once we've activated 4 platform adds we do not want to activate the 5th as it's a nuisance, so only 9 marks can be given to the infuser. Any marks over this just have to live, laugh, and love somewhere on the platform. ### Raid Movement > Will include a RaidPlan showing our movements and stuff, but later. ### WeakAuras > We're still discussing them. ### Video
